title: Trump Again Escalates Power Grabs in Bid to Fire Fed Member
summary: President Trump claimed he has cause to remove a member of the independent board who has not obeyed his demands to vote for lower interest rates.

title: Mortgage Fraud Claims Give Trump Weapon Against Lisa Cook and Others
summary: The director of Federal Housing Finance Agency could win the president an opening on the Federal Reserve board.

title: Trump Plays Reality Television Host at Cabinet Meeting That Lasts Hours
summary: As hours ticked by, President Trump played reality television host — “This has never been done before!” — as his cabinet members offered praise. It was a glimpse of how he runs his presidency.

title: Justice Dept. Broadens Inquiry Into Key Players in Russia Investigation
summary: It is the latest effort by President Trump and his allies to impugn the Russia investigation, which the president sees as having been a partisan witch hunt.

title: Judge Dismisses Trump Administration Suit Against Federal Bench in Maryland
summary: The judge used the ruling to take President Trump and some of his top aides to task for having repeatedly attacked other judges who have dared to rule against the White House.

title: Jokey Names for Detention Centers Face Criticism for Insensitivity
summary: The use of such names is part of a broader strategy that President Trump and his allies are leaning into in his second term.

title: A Teen Was Suicidal. ChatGPT Was the Friend He Confided In.
summary: More people are turning to general-purpose chatbots for emotional support. At first, Adam Raine, 16, used ChatGPT for schoolwork, but then he started discussing plans to end his life.

title: Donald Trump’s Big Gay Government
summary: On the town with the A-Gays of Washington, who have never been happier to be out, proud and Republican.

title: Purging ‘Equity’ Programs, G.O.P. Defunded Its Own Roads
summary: When Republicans repealed a Biden-era “access and equity” grant program for transportation, they canceled funding for projects in some of their own districts.

title: How the N.Y.P.D.’s Facial Recognition Tool Landed the Wrong Man in Jail
summary: Trevis Williams is eight inches taller than a man accused of flashing a woman in Union Square in February. The police arrested him anyway.

title: Macron Defends Call for Palestinian Statehood in Letter to Netanyahu
summary: President Emmanuel Macron of France also pushed back against accusations by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that he had not done enough to protect French Jews from antisemitic attacks.

title: The Deadly Risks of Reporting In Gaza
summary: Journalists endure the same harrowing reality as other Gazans: hunger and the constant threat of death. Those challenges risk further stifling what the world hears about the war.

title: Israel Links Deadly Hospital Attack in Gaza to Hamas Surveillance Camera
summary: The Israeli military said, without providing evidence, that its initial inquiry found that militants had placed an observation camera in the area. It said the attack killed six militants.

title: U.S. Envoy Talks Peace in Lebanon, but Stirs Anger With ‘Act Civilized’ Remark
summary: At a delicate moment in Lebanese politics, the envoy, Thomas J. Barrack Jr., provoked outrage by warning journalists at a news conference there not to be “animalistic.”

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce Are Engaged, Singer Announces
summary: The news was announced on Instagram: “Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married.”

title: Taylor Swift’s Engagement Ring Marks a Return to Vintage Elegance
summary: The pop star’s antique-inspired sparkler channels the “heirloom look,” reflecting a return to antique stones.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Relationship Timeline and Big Moments
summary: Bogie and Bacall, Marilyn and Joe DiMaggio, Beyoncé and Jay-Z: The new celebrity power couple might overshadow them all.

title: Gates Foundation Quietly Cuts Ties With Firm Linked to Democrats
summary: Officials made no mention of politics in cutting ties with a network of nonprofit funds, but Bill Gates has made other moves to insulate the charity from political pressures.

title: Democratic Party Scraps Resolutions on Israel and Gaza After Fraught Debate
summary: The measures were almost entirely symbolic, yet laid bare the broader fault lines dividing and shaping the party nearly two years after the war began.

title: SpaceX Starship Test Launch: How and When to Watch the 10th Test Flight
summary: After two consecutive scrubs, the Starship vehicle began its 10th test flight as Elon Musk’s company aims to overcome earlier setbacks.

title: Lafufus, Fake Labubus, Spawn Safety Warning and Raids
summary: The dupes of the cute-ugly toys have left consumer complaints and warnings about safety risks and potentially hazardous chemicals in their wake.

title: Where’s Your Evidence, Mr. President?
summary: If the courts allow Trump to get away with firing Lisa Cook, the Fed will be stripped of its insulation from political pressure.

title: Donald Trump’s Assault on Capitalism
summary: Trump’s personalized control of growing swaths of the economy will harm American economic freedom and competitiveness.

title: Fired Fed governor vows to sue Trump
summary: Also, a Social Security whistleblower. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: A Spate of Fake Shooting Calls Disrupts College Campuses
summary: As students arrive on campus for fall classes, several universities have locked down their campuses after reports of mass shootings that turned out to be false.

title: American Dream Mall Is Sued for Allowing Shopping on Sundays
summary: A lawsuit argues that the American Dream mall, by allowing the sale of lumber, furniture and “wearing apparel” on Sundays, has violated a “blue law” descended from a 1798 statute.

title: Donald McPherson, Naval Fighter Ace in World War II, Dies at 103
summary: One of the last surviving combat aces from the war, he took down five Japanese aircraft and helped save a destroyer during the Battle of Okinawa.
